data.title: Charles Dance: ‘I’m in love again at 76 — it’s fantastic’
data.meta_description: The actor’s new film was shot five years ago, but delayed by Covid. Today, his main memory of making it is meeting his girlfriend Alessandra Masi, more than 20 years his junior
data.text:
How lovely it is to get a straight answer. Charles Dance is talking about The Book of Vision, the surreal historical film in which he plays two doctors, one in contemporary London, the other in 18th-century Prussia. He shot it five years ago, but, thanks to Covid and distribution delays, it’s been released only this week. What’s his main memory of the shoot, I ask, expecting him to talk about the lavish locations in Italy and Belgium.

Dance, 76, pauses and half smiles. “To be honest, it’s meeting Alessandra,” he says in his oaky baritone. That’s Alessandra Masi, an Italian former actress who worked as a production manager on the film and became his girlfriend three years ago. Dance, who was married to Joanna
